title: Service Bulletin SB-2025-01: Hydraulic Pump Pressure Compensator Inspection and Replacement
content: This Service Bulletin provides instructions for the inspection and replacement of the pressure compensator assembly on Parker Hannifin PV3-300 hydraulic pumps installed on Boeing 737-800 aircraft. This bulletin addresses potential premature wear of the pressure compensator spool that may lead to erratic system pressure.

sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: This Service Bulletin provides instructions for the inspection and, if necessary, replacement of the pressure compensator assembly on Parker Hannifin PV3-300 hydraulic pumps (P/N: HYD-PUMP-001) installed on Boeing 737-800 aircraft. This bulletin addresses a potential issue with premature wear of the pressure compensator spool that may lead to erratic system pressure and reduced pump performance.

sections.title: Affected Aircraft
sections.content:
This Service Bulletin applies to all Boeing 737-800 aircraft with Parker Hannifin PV3-300 hydraulic pumps (P/N: HYD-PUMP-001) installed, with serial numbers in the range of SN10001 through SN12500.

NOTE: Pumps with serial numbers SN12501 and higher incorporate the improved pressure compensator design and are not affected by this Service Bulletin.

Affected Component:
- Part Number: HYD-PUMP-001
- Serial Number Range: SN10001 through SN12500
- Name: Hydraulic Pump, Engine-Driven
- Manufacturer: Parker Hannifin Corporation

Cross-reference: For detailed component information, refer to the Hydraulic Pump Component Maintenance Manual (doc-002).

sections.title: Description
sections.content:
Parker Hannifin has reported instances of premature wear on the pressure compensator spool in certain PV3-300 hydraulic pumps. This wear can result in the following issues:

1. Erratic system pressure fluctuations
2. Reduced pump efficiency
3. Increased case drain flow
4. Potential overheating of the hydraulic system
5. In extreme cases, inability to maintain required system pressure

The root cause has been identified as insufficient hardening of the compensator spool surface in pumps manufactured between January 2024 and March 2025 (serial numbers SN10001 through SN12500). Parker Hannifin has implemented an improved manufacturing process for the pressure compensator spool in all pumps with serial numbers SN12501 and higher.

Operators have reported the following symptoms that may indicate a worn pressure compensator spool:
- Fluctuating hydraulic system pressure indications
- Slow or erratic operation of hydraulic-powered components
- Increased hydraulic fluid temperature
- Increased case drain flow during routine maintenance checks

WARNING: If left unaddressed, a severely worn pressure compensator spool could potentially result in loss of hydraulic system pressure, affecting flight control systems powered by the affected hydraulic system.

sections.title: Corrective Action
sections.content:
The following actions are required:

4.1 INSPECTION

Perform a functional check of the hydraulic pump pressure compensator as follows:

1. Connect hydraulic test equipment to the aircraft hydraulic test ports
2. Operate the hydraulic system at normal pressure (3,000 psi / 20,684 kPa)
3. Monitor system pressure for 5 minutes
4. Cycle hydraulic demand by operating flight controls through full range of motion
5. Monitor case drain flow

Acceptance Criteria:
- System pressure must remain within 2,850-3,150 psi (19,650-21,718 kPa)
- Pressure fluctuations must not exceed ±150 psi (±1,034 kPa)
- Case drain flow must not exceed 1.5 gallons per minute (5.7 liters per minute)

4.2 REPLACEMENT

If the pump fails the functional check, or if the pump is within the affected serial number range and has accumulated more than 2,000 flight hours since new or overhaul, replace the pressure compensator assembly as follows:

WARNING: Ensure all hydraulic pressure is relieved before performing maintenance on the pump. Failure to do so may result in personal injury or equipment damage.

Tools Required:
- Standard mechanic's tool set
- Torque wrench (0-25 ft-lb / 0-34 Nm)
- New pressure compensator assembly (P/N: HYD-COMP-002)
- New O-rings and backup rings (P/N: HYD-SEAL-KIT-001)

Procedure:
1. Gain access to the hydraulic pump on the engine
2. Depressurize the hydraulic system
3. Clean the area around the pressure compensator
4. Remove the four bolts securing the compensator to the pump housing
5. Carefully remove the compensator assembly
6. Inspect the compensator bore in the pump housing for damage
7. Install new O-rings and backup rings on the new compensator assembly
8. Install the new compensator assembly
9. Torque the four mounting bolts to 18-20 ft-lb (24-27 Nm) in a diagonal pattern
10. Perform the functional check described in Section 4.1

Refer to the Hydraulic Pump Component Maintenance Manual (doc-002) for detailed disassembly and assembly procedures.

sections.title: Compliance
sections.content:
5.1 COMPLIANCE CATEGORIES

This Service Bulletin is categorized as RECOMMENDED.

The following compliance times are recommended:

Category A - URGENT (Safety Issue):
- Not applicable for this Service Bulletin

Category B - PRIORITY:
- For pumps with more than 2,000 flight hours: Within the next 300 flight hours or 60 days, whichever occurs first
- For pumps with less than 2,000 flight hours: At next scheduled A-check or within 600 flight hours, whichever occurs first

Category C - ROUTINE:
- Not applicable for this Service Bulletin

5.2 REPORTING REQUIREMENTS

Operators are requested to report the results of all inspections and replacements to Parker Hannifin Technical Support within 30 days of accomplishment. Include the following information:

1. Aircraft registration number
2. Pump serial number
3. Pump time since new or overhaul
4. Inspection results (pass/fail)
5. Observed system pressure and fluctuations
6. Case drain flow measurements
7. Description of any observed anomalies

Submit reports to:
Parker Hannifin Technical Support
Email: techsupport@parker.com
Reference: SB-2025-01

5.3 DOCUMENTATION

Record compliance with this Service Bulletin in the aircraft maintenance records. Include the following information:

1. Service Bulletin number and title
2. Date of accomplishment
3. Aircraft registration number
4. Pump serial number
5. Action taken (inspection only or inspection and replacement)
6. Name and certificate number of the technician performing the work
7. Name and certificate number of the inspector approving the work

sections.title: Material Information
sections.content:
6.1 PARTS REQUIRED

The following parts may be required to comply with this Service Bulletin:

For Inspection:
- No parts required

For Replacement:
- Pressure Compensator Assembly (P/N: HYD-COMP-002), Quantity: 1
- O-ring and Seal Kit (P/N: HYD-SEAL-KIT-001), Quantity: 1

6.2 TOOLING REQUIRED

The following tools are required to comply with this Service Bulletin:

For Inspection:
- Hydraulic Test Equipment (P/N: HYD-TEST-002)
- Pressure Gauge, 0-5,000 psi (P/N: HYD-GAUGE-001)
- Flow Meter, 0-10 GPM (P/N: HYD-FLOW-001)

For Replacement:
- Standard Mechanic's Tool Set
- Torque Wrench, 0-25 ft-lb (P/N: TOOL-TORQUE-001)
- O-ring Installation Tool Set (P/N: TOOL-ORING-001)

6.3 AVAILABILITY AND ORDERING

Replacement parts are available from Parker Hannifin authorized distributors. When ordering parts, provide the following information:

1. Aircraft type and registration number
2. Service Bulletin number (SB-2025-01)
3. Part number and quantity required

Estimated lead time for replacement parts is 5-7 business days. For AOG (Aircraft On Ground) situations, contact Parker Hannifin Customer Service at +1-800-555-0100 for expedited shipping options.
